subject: Re: [junit] Object deserialisation error
msgSnippet: Also, there may be some cross dependancy causing the class to not load properly.  Check and make sure that any dependant libraries (jars/classes) are the same

Also, there may be some cross dependancy causing the class to not load 
properly.  Check and make sure that any dependant libraries 
(jars/classes) are the same version on both sides as well as compiled 
with the same JDK Javac version.

Best Wishes,
Dave


Mike Clark wrote:
> Aditya Yadav wrote:
> 
> 
>>hi!
>>
>>I'm serialising a class and sending it over a socket to another machine which does not have the classes of the agent. So I'm making two trips, first I'm transferring the jar file containing the classes and I'm using Class.forname("agentclass",true,customjarclassloader) to load the classes.
>>Then in the next connection I'm transferring the serialised class object to the host. But on reaching the host it gives a ClassNotFoundError when I'm trying to deserialise the object.
>> 
>>
> 
> 
> I would write a test from the receiving machine's perspective.  That is, 
> the classpath used for the test would not include the JAR file. 
>  Instead, the test would use the custom class loader to attempt to load 
> the class from the JAR file.  
> 
> In other words, I'd verify that the custom class loader was working as 
> expected, regardless of serialization.  Then I'd tackle the 
> serialization issue.
> 
> Mike
>
